title.narrative: Envelope 1: Enhance integrated health services through the provision of life-saving obstetric and newborn care, and specialized GBV services to vulnerable IDPs and host communities in Daret Azza in northwest Syria.

description.narrative:
SRD is proposing to enhance access to lifesaving, integrated health services through the provision of primary and secondary reproductive and child healthcare to vulnerable populations, particularly women and children for a period 8 months in the Daret Azza, Jebel Saman, Aleppo through Al Fardous Hospital (B0200124) currently operated by SRD which provides Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care (CEmONC) services. The essential, emergency health interventions provided at this facility are critical for reducing and preventing maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality. A series of clinical training will be delivered to staff throughout the life of the project in order to build and strengthen the capacity of service providers. the hospital includes: Outpatient department, Gynecological inpatient department 13 beds, Pediatric inpatient department 21 beds, Incubators (10 incubators), ICU unit (2beds, 2 incubators, 5 ventilators). The average monthly caseload of the hospital during last period is divided as the following: - Outpatient consultations: 4800 OPD - Inpatients (RH and pediatrics): 475 - ANC visits: 1120 - Vaginal deliveries: 300 - C-sections: 75 The total project targeted persons were calculated based on the average case load for 8 months. the hospital utilize 40 medical workers to operate the hospital 24/7 including: 3 Gyn/OB 3 Physician-Resident 3 Pediatrician 1 Physician Anesthesia 1 Pharmacist 4 Midwives 16 Nurses 3 Technicians-Lab 3 Technicians-ICU 3 Technicians-Anesthesia
The integrated approach includes coordination between GBV case management and SRH teams to identify and refer cases ‎in need based on the assessment of each case. SRD will ensure that project staff are trained on GBV basics and SOPs to ‎ensure safe identification and referral to internal services of this project including CMR or external services ‎based on case needs.‎
